comment.body: @P2P: Yeah.
@Nofish You have much hubs, ban them!
@P2P: Yes, but right now we should ban them. Then spammer won't be able to spam right now.
@西木野真姬: But not all hubs support KaffieID.
@Mv00: Please
@西木野真姬: But much hubs don't. Data is in hubs, not ZeroMe site.
@Mv00: Thx
@Mv00: Maybe they are using Tor to change IP and register new ZeroIDs? *Not that I wanted to help 'em...*
@Mv00: They can write a script like 1. stop zeronet 2. delete users.json 3. start zeronet 4. register zeroid 5. register zerome 6. comment 7. repeat
@西木野真姬: Maybe that server is big?
@Mv00: In theory there is no difference between theory and practice. In practice there is. (c)
@Mv00: Why do you say `my experiment`?
@Mv00: I thought about spam on ZeroNet a lot... Now @Nofish: finally has to do something.
@Mv00: Because ya' know, that can last longer.
@Mv00: If this is like ZeroSites where you choose what you download and what you don't and stars are added (probably those who have mute list should be starred, not spammers), then ok.
@Mv00: But peer count is not reliable...
@Mv00: Like more comments = better?
@Mv00: So `This is cool!` from many spammers...
В разных хабах по-разному. У Вас White Hub или какой-то другой? Он при регистрации указывается.
@x86128: Картинки не учитываются.
@blurHY: And?.. I believed that's what most developers wanted
@caryoscelus: Take a look at the example plugin page. I believe it (read: ZeroNet core) shows enough warnings.

Come on, people. You have to either deal with people being dumb enough to install unverified plugins, or with lack of functions. If nofish doesn't accept PeerMessage to the core distribution, at least *this* sounds like a good idea.
@caryoscelus: It's in ZeroBlog, I'll send you a link right now
@caryoscelus: Ok... And what if the plugin needs to access filesystem? E.g. a users.json backuper or something. Are we introducing plugin permissions?

What about taking a look at my [BackgroundProcessing plugin](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/Plugin-BackgroundProcessing)? It'd be a lot better if we could at least keep some stuff consistent with original ZeroNet.
@~Publicality~: +1

*blurHY:*

> For 2, we can create a token/coin, which is supplied with advertising, so users don’t need to directly pay for it.

*Also blurHY:*

> There’s a new stuff called IPSE for IPFS, but I think it’s just a new shitcoin, so buzzwordy.

Choose one.
@blurHY: The desktop client might suck, but riot.im is awesome
@blurHY: It's not *fully* decentralized, but it's federated. Still a good service nevertheless
@Znnex: Of course no, lol
@Znnex: Well, of course you will leak your IP if you're using a web service. You can use Tor Browser however.

Name.YO being treated so well by the community was something that I didn't expect at all. It's a step backwards, it was actually created because I didn't want to wait for @geekless'es ID-based domain proposal being implemented.
Besides, Name.YO is a working project that's not even beta anymore, whilst IPZN is only a proposal.

@blurHY: Why though? People want to have a single "make it good" button. Name.YO provides such a solution, while IPZN sounds rather difficult to non-developers. You'd better explain how it works without technical vocabulary.
@~Publicality~: +1. There's a major difference between "I don't want to spend time" and "I have no time to spend". The latter applies to most people.
